description: Richly structured, this dense wine has solid tannins that balance with the black fruits. It is a complex wine, poised and confident while not losing sight of the Margaux elegance. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Cantenac Brown 2016  Margaux

description: Dark and concentrated, this wine offers depth and intensity. It has great ripeness as well as fine tannins that are integrated into the fruit. It is so juicy and exuberant that it's hard to remember the tannins that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2016  Pauillac

description: Richly spicy with swathes of black fruit and dark tannins, this powerful wine also shows great elegance. Juicy fruits shine through the structure to give a wine with a good future. Drink this rich wine from 2024.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2016 La Croix Ducru-Beaucaillou  (Saint-Julien)

description: Now run biodynamically, this estate is managed by Claire Villars-Lurton. This wine's bright fruit is crisp and full of acidity. The structure underlines the fruitiness, bringing some weight to the wine. It needs time, so drink from 2026.
title: Château Ferrière 2016  Margaux

description: The second wine of Haut-Brion reflects the same structure as the first. Here, the fruit is already showing well, giving a fresher element that will allow it to develop more quickly. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2016 Le Clarence de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: This estate on the north side of the village of Margaux is performing at its peak. As befits the vintage it's a rich wine with big tannins. But it also has the style that characterizes a Margaux, with a smooth, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2016  Margaux

description: This wine has power and a rich character that almost overwhelms. Intense tannins along with dark-chocolate flavors and huge concentration give a massive wine that shows some of the alcohol in its edge of pepper. The wine will calm and soften although it will always remain huge. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Troplong Mondot 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: The name Mi-Pente means “midslope,” and this is considered the best point of the slope, neither too high nor too low. The wine is bold, dark and very rich. Black currant and berry fruits are prominent, as are the tannins that will allow this fine wine to age. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de la Butte 2017 Mi-Pente 40 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

description: This six-acre walled vineyard, one of Thierry Germain's top parcels, is in the north of the appellation close to the Loire River. Like all this producer's wines, it is produced from biodynamically grown fruit that has translated into magnificent red-berry flavors. The young structure is profound and needs time. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Clos de l'Echelier  (Saumur-Champigny)

description: This is a beautiful wine, aged tawny at its peak. The wood aging has given the old gold character that shines though the spirit, the sweet nuttiness and hints of red fruits to give a plushy, wood-paneled wine that, of course, is ready to drink.
title: Dow's NV 30 Years Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Juicy red fruit is lightly spiced in cinnamon, clove and a tangle of toasted oak in this well-made, 100% varietal wine. Red and black cherry show a succulence on the midpalate as complex, integrated structure supports a memorable experience on the spicy earthy finish.
title: Encanto 2013 Usibelli Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Light and delicate in color and build, this is brimming in fresh acidity, with an exotic forest-floor complement and lingering hits of Asian spice and licorice. Made in tiny amounts, it speaks to the coast's ability to be vibrant and nervy within a context of savory intrigue.
title: Furthermore 2015 Starbridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Herbal and leathery, this impressive wine delights in aromas of white pepper, tar and meat. Robustly textured with full-bodied ripeness, it offers savory exoticism that's hard to resist. It was aged in 25% new French oak.
title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Nun's Canyon Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with earthy aromas of wild berry, new leather and Mediterranean brush. The savory, balanced palate offers succulent black cherry, raspberry jam, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2029.
title: Michele Satta 2015 Cavaliere Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Though known more as a Zinfandel house, this estate winery clearly is home to epic Syrah vines, as this bottling rocks the nose with clean nutmeg, roasted black fruit and savory char on the nose. The wine is lush and thick on the palate, with power and elegance, combining thick tannins and bright acid with smoked black-plum flavors.
title: Opolo 2016 Reserve Collection Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

description: This is a classically structured, delicious Bordeaux blend which allows 55% Cabernet Franc to take the lead, with 31% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot in support. Sanguine, herbal and elegant, it shows red currant, clove, cedar and pencil, with a lasting toasty note of dust and oak.
title: Arrow & Branch 2015 Red (Napa Valley)

description: Wood aging in older barrels has given this rich wine its smooth patina and generous tannins. The fresh red-berry fruit is all there along with acidity, but the depth and balance of this single-vineyard wine give it such sophistication. Drink now.
title: Bernard Baudry 2016 Les Clos Guillet  (Chinon)

description: The powerful tannins of this wine reflect the vintage while allowing room for fresh black-currant flavors that are developing well. It is well balanced, rich as well as succulent and sure to age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: This 50-acre, family-owned property is surrounded by some of the most famous names in Pauillac. The wine shares some of the same fine Cabernet Sauvignon flavors, ripe with intense black-currant fruitiness that partners with dusty tannins and acidity. It's a wine for aging. Do not expect to drink before 2025.
title: Château Fonbadet 2016  Pauillac

description: This is a dense, smoky wine with powerful tannins. It follows the line of richness set since the 2014 vintage and balances rich black fruits and concentrated tannins cut with final acidity. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2016  Saint-Julien
